item.title: ENGINE HIGH STAGE (L & R) Bleed Valve Systems

numlitem.para: Valve is secured closed,
A minimum N1 is maintained on the associated engine in icing conditions as follows:
(P&W)
70% N1 above 10,000 feet MSL
60% N1 below 10,000 feet MSL
Descent, approach and landing are not made in icing conditions within 5,000 feet AGL, and
Remaining (opposite) engine bleed system is operative.

note.para: For engine start during single engine taxi with HPSOV deferred on the operating engine; when APU air is available, APU must be started and used to start the remaining engine.
When APU air is unavailable with HPSOV deferred; both engines must be started with a ground air source.

numlitem.para: Operate with bleed air switch normal.
In icing conditions, maintain a minimum N1 as follows:
(P&W)
70% N1 above 10,000 feet MSL
60% N1 below 10,000 feet MSL
Do not execute descent, approach and landing in icing conditions below 5,000 feet AGL.
No icing conditions below 5000 ft. AGL at intended destination.

placard.para: Placard near BLEED Indicator light located on Bleed Air Supply Module (M10259) on P5 panel "HI PRESS S/O VLV INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Notify Flight Dispatch. Flight operations may be affected.
Lock valve in closed position as outline below.

warning.para: FAILURE TO FOLLOW MAINTENANCE 78-31-00/201 COULD RESULT IN INJURY TO PERSONNEL AND DAMAGE TO FAN COWL, CORE COWL AND FAN DUCT COWL AND THRUST REVERSER.

numlitem.para: For PW engine, open right fan cowl, right core cowl and right thrust reverser fan duct cowl (MM 78-31-001201).
For RB211 engine, open left fan C-duct and thrust reverser (MM 78-31-001201).

Rotate the manual override hex nut on the high pressure shutoff valve clockwise until the poppet valve lever falls into the lock arm assembly notch. The word "LOCKED" should be visible on the valve body beneath the cam. Ensure the poppet valve lever is not in the detent position.

note.para: This locks valve in closed position. Valve must be manually wrenched from CLOSE before valve will open.
A faulty, or out of calibration, over-pressure sensor could cause the HI STAGE light to illuminate and advisory EICAS message to appear, regardless of valve position.

numlitem.para: Disconnect High Stage Pilot electrical connector, cap and stow.
Close fan duct cowl and thrust reverser.
